channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: NZ extends alert levels: What you need to know
item.description: Auckland's lockdown will probably continue until at least 26 August, the wage subsidy will be extended and an election date may emerge over the weekend.

item.title: Auckland lockdown to continue for 12 more days
item.description: Auckland will remain in alert level three for a full two weeks, with the government announcing that the country will remain at current Covid-19 alert levels for 12 more days.

item.title: Cabinet extends wage subsidy for third time as second lockdown continues
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has announced that with ongoing raised alert levels, the wage subsidy scheme will be extended.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Constable Matthew Hunt loses name suppression
item.description: The man accused of murdering Constable Matthew Hunt can be named for the first time, although no photos of the accused can be published.

item.title: Sharper focus on testing for customer-facing border staff
item.description: All frontline border staff are now being tested for Covid-19, Health Minister Chris Hipkins says.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates for Friday 14 August
item.description: There were 13 new cases announced today, the current alert levels were extended for three days and the hunt for the source of the current outbreak continues. See how the day unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Ministry apologises over linking Pakuranga College to Covid-19 cluster
item.description: The Ministry of Health has apologised after it incorrectly named an Auckland school as being linked to the new cluster of Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 12 new confirmed cases, one probable in NZ
item.description: There are 12 new cases and one probable case of Covid-19 in the community today, Director General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield has revealed, with two of the new cases in Tokoroa. Watch the latest briefing live here.

item.title: Canterbury District Health Board appoints Dr Andrew Brant as acting chief executive
item.description: The Canterbury District Health Board has appointed an interim replacement to fill in after the resignation of its chief executive.

item.title: Border worker appalled at lack of testing and safety measures
item.description: A border worker says she and others have repeatedly raised their fears about the lack of health checks and safety protocols.

item.title: Japanese, Belgian travellers who left New Zealand test positive for Covid-19
item.description: A Japanese traveller who left the country last Saturday and a Belgian traveller who left the country last Thursday have since tested positive for Covid-19, but neither had symptoms when they were here.

item.title: Second arrest during homicide investigation following discovery of body on Coromandel highway
item.description: There has been a second arrest in connection with a body found on a Coromandel highway.

item.title: Comanchero arrests: Fonua pleads guilty to organised crime charges
item.description: A man arrested after police raided the Comanchero motorcycle gang has admitted his role in an organised crime group.

item.title: How New Zealanders are reacting to the Covid-19 alert level changes
item.description: New Zealanders outside of Auckland are filled with anxiety, frustration and a touch of apathy as they grapple with the possibility of returning to life under level 3 or even level 4 restrictions.

item.title: Covid-19: Lack of testing of staff at border 'extraordinary' - Skegg
item.description: The lack of testing of staff at the border is extraordinary, a prominent epidemiologist says.

item.title: ECE centres fear financial impact of extended Auckland Covid-19 lockdown
item.description: Auckland early learning centre owners say they can't survive without parents' fees and they would need government support if attendance was banned for an extended period.

item.title: Police raids uncover banned firearms in Porirua, Lower Hutt
item.description: Police raids on two properties with gang links in the Wellington region have uncovered illegal firearms, including a banned AR-15 semi-automatic assault rifle.

item.title: Phil Goff: Auckland will need more government help
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff says if the city was to go back into alert level 4 it would need government assistance.
